items.title: Frozen Shoulder
items.content:
Information about the program

The Frozen Shoulder program is designed to assist you in managing and alleviating the pain and stiffness associated with a frozen shoulder. This condition, also known as adhesive capsulitis, restricts the shoulder's range of motion and can be caused by various factors, including inflammation, injury, or prolonged immobility. Active participation in the program is crucial for your recovery. The program is tailored to improve shoulder mobility and function gradually.

Your progression matters

We will assess your pain level and range of motion regularly, adjusting the program based on your feedback to create a more suitable plan tailored to your progression.

Aim of the program

  • Reduce pain and inflammation in the affected shoulder

  • Restore and improve shoulder mobility

  • Enhance strength and stability in the shoulder region

  • Promote proper posture

  • Gradual return to daily activities involving the shoulder

Equipment required

  • Cold & Heat Pack

  • Towel

  • Tennis Ball

  • Resistance Bands

Please remember to consult with your healthcare professional before starting the program, and let them know about any changes in your condition during the program.

items.title: Sciatica
items.content:
Information about the program

The Sciatica Management Program is designed to guide and support you through the pain and discomfort associated with sciatica. Sciatica often occurs due to compression or irritation of the sciatic nerve, leading to radiating pain, numbness, and tingling sensations down the leg. Active participation in the program is essential for your recovery, and the plan is tailored to facilitate your return to physical activity and daily routines.

Your progression matters

We will assess your pain level regularly and adjust the program based on your feedback to create a more suitable plan for the subsequent weeks, ensuring a personalized and effective approach to your recovery.

Aim of the program

  • Alleviate acute pain and inflammation immediately

  • Promote nerve health and flexibility

  • Improve flexibility and mobility in the affected area

  • Strengthen core and supporting muscles

  • Enhance posture

  • Gradual return to physical activities

Equipment required

  • Cold & Heat Pack

  • Core Belt

  • Resistance Bands

Remember to consult with your healthcare professional before starting the program, and keep them informed about any changes in your condition during the program.

items.title: Piriformis Syndrome
items.content:
Information about the programme

The Piriformis Syndrome Management Programme is designed to guide and support you through the pain and discomfort associated with piriformis syndrome. Piriformis syndrome is often characterised by irritation or compression of the sciatic nerve by the piriformis muscle, resulting in radiating pain, numbness, and tingling sensations down the leg. Active participation in the programme is essential for your recovery, and the plan is tailored to facilitate your return to physical activity and daily routines.

Your progression matters

We will assess your pain level regularly and adjust the programme based on your feedback to create a better plan for the next weeks, ensuring a personalised and effective approach to your recovery.

Aim of the program

  • Alleviate acute pain and inflammation immediately.

  • Promote nerve health and flexibility.

  • Improve flexibility and mobility in the affected area.

  • Strengthen core and supporting muscles.

  • Enhance posture.

  • Gradual return to physical activities.

Equipment required

  • Resistance Bands

Important note: Remember to consult with your healthcare professional before starting the programme, and keep them informed about any changes in your condition during the program.

items.title: Neck Strain
items.content:
Information about the program

The Neck Strain program is crafted to guide and support you through the pain and discomfort associated with neck strain. Neck strain often occurs due to tension or stress in the neck muscles, leading to pain, stiffness, and discomfort. Active participation in the program is crucial for your recovery, and the plan is tailored to facilitate your return to physical activity and daily routines.

Your progression matters

We will regularly assess your pain level and adjust the programme based on your feedback to create a better plan for the next weeks, ensuring that we have a personalised and effective approach to your recovery.

Aim of the program

  • Alleviate acute pain and inflammation immediately

  • Promote neck health and flexibility

  • Improve flexibility and mobility in the affected area

  • Strengthen core and supporting muscles

  • Enhance posture

  • Gradual return to physical activities

Equipment required

  • Heat Pack

  • Resistance Bands

Remember to consult with your healthcare professional before starting the program, and keep them informed about any changes in your condition during program.

items.title: Upper Back Strain
items.content:
Information about the program

The Upper Back Strain program is designed to guide and support you through the pain and discomfort associated with an upper back strain. Upper back strain often occurs due to muscle overuse or injury, resulting in localized pain and stiffness. Active participation in the program is essential for your recovery, and the plan is tailored to facilitate your return to physical activity and daily routines.

Your progression matters

We will assess your pain level regularly and adjust the programme based on your feedback to create a better plan for the next weeks, ensuring that we have a personalised and effective approach to your recovery.

Aim of the program

  • Alleviate acute pain and inflammation immediately

  • Promote muscle health and flexibility

  • Improve flexibility and mobility in the affected area

  • Strengthen core and supporting muscles

  • Enhance posture

  • Gradual return to physical activities

Equipment required

  • Resistance Bands

Remember to consult with your healthcare professional before starting the programme, and keep them informed about any changes in your condition during the program.

items.title: Patella Tendinopathy (Runner's Knee)
items.content:
Information about the program

The Patella Tendinopathy (Runner's Knee) Management Program is crafted to guide and support you through the discomfort associated with Patella Tendinopathy. This condition often arises due to overuse or strain on the patellar tendon, leading to pain around the knee. Active participation in the program is crucial for your recovery, and the plan is tailored to facilitate your return to physical activity and daily routines.

Your progression matters

We will regularly assess your pain level and adjust the program based on your feedback to create a better plan for the upcoming weeks. This ensures a personalised and effective approach to your recovery.

Aim of the programme

  • Alleviate acute pain and inflammation immediately

  • Promote tendon health and flexibility

  • Improve flexibility and mobility in the affected area

  • Strengthen core and supporting muscles

  • Enhance posture

  • Gradual return to physical activities

Equipment required

  • Resistance Bands

Remember to consult with your healthcare professional before commencing the program and keep them informed about any changes in your condition during the program.
